title: Bihar CM transfers ₹1,247.34 crore to pensioners
content: Over the last month, about 1 lakh new beneficiaries have been added to the pension scheme. Mr. Kumar said that he had been working for the development of the State since coming to power in November 2005

title: Ramadoss vs. Anbumani — the father-son feud in Pattali Makkal Katchi | Explained
content: Pattali Makkal Katchi’s ongoing leadership fight between the party’s founder S. Ramadoss and his son-party president Anbumani Ramadoss has created a split within PMK, causing conflict – right from senior leadership down to the grassroots.

title: By-elections: YSRCP alleges police bias
content: The delegation alleged that the officers had been filing false cases, making illegal detentions, and protecting TDP activists accused of attacking YSRCP cadre

title: ZPTC by-elections: Jagan alleges misuse of power by TDP
content: Government undermining democracy and engaging in anarchic politics in Pulivendula and Ontimitta, he says

title: Fairly widespread rain likely in North and South Coastal A.P. from August 13
content: IMD forecasts heavy to very heavy rainfall for the two regions on August 15 and 16; the overall deficit rainfall percentage in the State has come down to 19.4% from 25% earlier this week

title: Rajgopal Reddy’s issue not discussed at Congress party’s disciplinary committee meeting
content: Konda Murali, husband of Ms.Surekha, attended the meeting and gave his version on the recent spat with the Warangal MLAs.

title: Post demoliton of ‘caste wall’, security tightened at Muthuladampatti in Karur
content: The task of demolition of the structure began at 3.30 p.m on Saturday and came to an end at 2.30 a.m on Sunday. I

title: Regional rivals urged to unite ahead of Bodoland polls in Assam
content: The appeal follows the announcement of the Bharatiya Janata Party not to go for an alliance and contest all seats in the Bodoland Territorial Council

title: Robert Vadra gave evasive replies, put onus on deceased associates: ED chargesheet in Gurugram land deal case
content: The ED also alleged that in the alleged money laundering linked real estate transaction, Robert Vadra exerted "undue influence" on Haryana government officials through former chief minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda

title: Telangana Deputy CM lays foundation stone for ₹600-crore. Jawahar Lift Irrigation Scheme in Khammam district
content: Urges A.P. government to halt daily diversion of 11 tmcft water from upper Srisailam reservoir via Pothireddypadu lift system, warning it would drain the project in 25 days and cause severe losses to farmers in Telangana’s Nalgonda and Khammam districts

title: The ECI’s lack of transparency is worrying
content: By keeping critical information under wraps and failing to publicly justify its actions, the Election Commission of India risks eroding voter trust

title: Technical snag: Delhi-bound Air India flight diverted to Chennai; four Kerala MPs among passengers
content: Among the passengers on board were four Kerala MPs, including K.C. Venugopal, K. Radhakrishnan, Kodikkunnil Suresh and Adoor Prakash

title: ‘Quantum’ leap in addressing challenges of the 21st century
content: Quantum computing holds the future as it is set to drive the next technological breakthroughs, says Principal of Andhra University College of Engineering Sasibhushana Rao

title: T.N. government designates district jail in Salem as ‘special camp’ for Bangladesh nationals
content: Around 180 Bangladeshis in Central Prison, Puzhal, will be accommodated at the special camp till the disposal of their cases and deportation

title: Karnataka govt. backs out of solar power project in five backward villages citing costs
content: This is the second renewable energy-related project that has been dropped by the government that was announced in the 2024-25 State budget

title: Dalit left groups to start protest from August 11 seeking immediate implementation of Nagamohan Das panel report on internal quota
content: Amid pressure on the Karnataka government to hand over the H.N. Nagamohan Das Commission report on internal reservation to a Cabinet sub-committee to study it, several Dalit organisations, under the banner of Federation for Social Justice for Scheduled Castes, will start their indefinite protest from Monday morning, seeking immediate implementation of the report.

title: Education should not be sold or restricted to some, says Stalin
content: Speaking at an event held in honour of educationist Vasanthi Devi, he recalls her contributions in taking education to the underprivileged

title: Police gear up for Ganesh and Dasara festivities with foolproof security arrangements in Andhra Pradesh
content: Organisers must share idol height, pandal details, fire safety measures, immersion date, and procession routes for Ganesh Navaratri Utsavams starting August 27, say officials

title: Eagles' Dickerson injured in practice, exits on cart
content: Eagles Pro Bowl left guard Landon Dickerson was helped off the field and carted indoors after suffering an apparent right leg injury during the team's open practice Sunday night.

title: Rose rallies late, tops Spaun in St. Jude playoff
content: Justin Rose made up a three-shot deficit over the last five holes against hard-luck Tommy Fleetwood, and then made two birdies in a playoff against U.S. Open champion J.J. Spaun to win the FedEx St. Jude Championship on Sunday.

title: Raleigh clubs MLB-best 45th HR in Mariners' win
content: Cal Raleigh hit his major-league-leading 45th home run in a four-run first inning, and Seattle hung on for a 6-3 victory over Tampa Bay on Sunday.

title: Bills delivers Pennsylvania first LLSWS since '78
content: Behind Reagan Bills' two-way heroics, Johnstown, Pennsylvania, defeated Floyds Knobs, Indiana, 1-0 on Sunday to win the state's first Little League Softball World Series since 1978.

title: Olympian Rivera, 17, wins at U.S. championships
content: Hezly Rivera, the 17-year-old Olympic gold medalist, pulled away for a victory at the U.S. gymnastics championships Sunday.

title: 'Cool milestone': Verlander gets 3,500th career K
content: Justin Verlander added another memorable chapter to his legendary pitching career Sunday, becoming the 10th pitcher in MLB history to reach 3,500 career strikeouts.

title: Palou clinches 4th IndyCar title in last 5 seasons
content: Alex Palou wrapped up his fourth IndyCar championship in the past five seasons Sunday at Portland International Raceway when title contender Pato O'Ward lost power early in the race.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Napoli join Everton in battle for Jack Grealish
content: Napoli have joined Everton in the race for Jack Grealish. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins fourth race this season
content: Shane van Gisbergen tied a Cup Series record with his fourth straight road-course victory, blowing out the competition again at Watkins Glen International.

title: Do Draft list: Henry, Purdy, Kelce among players being undervalued
content: In the perennial counterpart to the Do Not Draft list, Eric Karabell discusses players who are being underappreciated in fantasy football drafts.

title: 🏈 Ranking all 136 FBS teams ahead of the season
content: From Tier 1 to Tier 20, David Hale ranks all 136 college football program into tiers ahead of the 2025 season.

title: 🏆 Passan's 2025 MLB trade deadline awards
content: Here's what we learned from this year's deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: 🏀 Crypto group says it organized sex toy tosses
content: A self-described cryptocurrency enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: 🏈 ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: 🧂 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: 👊 Khabib hopes McGregor changes lifestyle
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Brewers pitcher Jacob Misiorowski draws rare Pokémon Charizard card after win over Mets
content: The Milwaukee Brewers' vibes were high when they pulled a rare Pokémon card after extending their win streak to seven.

title: Dean Burmester wins LIV Chicago in three-way playoff
content: Dean Burmester beat Jon Rahm and Josele Ballester in a three-way playoff Sunday to win LIV Golf Chicago.

title: 'I want it to be my life': Why Patrick Mahomes is much more than a celebrity product endorser
content: For an active athlete of his stature, the Chiefs QB has been unusually involved in his coffee brand's coast-to-coast growth.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: Texas to Pennsylvania: Can you ace the last 'SportsCenter' 50-in-50 quiz?
content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

title: Committee favours cancellation of kidney transplant licences of two hospitals
content: The committee was formed to inquire into the illegal kidney sale racket involving the Dhanalakshmi Srinivasan Medical College and Hospital in Perambalur and Cethar Hospital in Tiruchi. It has also recommended that action be initiated against brokers  Anandan and Stanley Mohan under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhitha

title: Forces engaging two groups of terrorists in J&K’s forest areas
content: Soldiers have launched an intelligence-based operation in Kishtwar; an anti-terror operation has entered its 10th day in Kulgam

title: BJP likens Rahul Gandhi to ‘Joseph Goebbels’ over Election Commission remarks
content: Party accuses LoP of making unsubstantiated allegations; Congress launches portal to seek accountability on voters’ list

title: INDIA bloc MPs to march to Election Commission; Congress launches online campaign to seek support over alleged poll fraud
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge to host INDIA bloc MPs for a dinner meeting to formulate a common strategy on the issue of alleged poll fraud

title: Karnataka govt. meeting as much as 87.37% for the Namma Metro project cost: CM
content: The Centre is giving just about 12.63% of the project cost, while the State government is meeting 87.37%. So far, the Centre has provided only ₹7,468.86 crore of the total ₹59,139 crore spent on the project, says Siddaramaiah

title: Railway budget for Karnataka jumped nearly ninefold under Modi: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The Minister says that the country is the world’s second-largest mobile phone manufacturer, with Bengaluru’s Devanahalli emerging as a significant hub for iPhone production

title: Countries must make policies to mitigate crisis from tariff wars: Nigerian farm scientist Ademola Adenle
content: India can adopt bio-fortified crops technology to achieve nutritional security, says Prof. Adenle; “if you are not investing in R&D, it will be difficult to compete with China, United States, and some European countries”

title: Initiate reforms to take Karnataka forward, PM tells State govt.
content: Urging Karnataka to lead the Atma Nirbhar Bharat with its talent, Modi says that Bengaluru should contribute more in Make in India initiative

title: India has set an example in lion conservation: Bhupender Yadav
content: The rise in population of Asiatic lion shows India’s intimate relationship with nature and wildlife, says Bhupender Yadav; praises the unique bond between the pastoralist Maldhari community and lions as a model of coexistence

title: External Affairs Ministry set to brief House panel on India-U.S. relationship
content: The Ministry is expected to tell the panel that the imposition of additional tariffs by Trump is a result of ‘flawed assumptions’ and that India remains ‘committed to engaging constructively’ through ‘dialogue and mutual respect’; it will also highlight the bipartisan nature of India-U.S. relationship

title: Deputy Chief Minister Shivakumar seeks ₹1.5 lakh crore Central aid for upgrading Bengaluru infrastructure
content: Emphasising Bengaluru’s role as India’s technology capital and the nation’s second-largest tax contributor, he points out to the urgent need to address mounting urban pressures, such as severe traffic congestion, depleting water resources, and inadequate waste management systems

title: Attempt to save Nimisha Priya was about humanity, not taking credit: Kanthapuram
content: Focus should be on nurturing spiritual growth and educational development in the community since education is the key to a nation’s prosperity and advancement, says Sunni leader

title: Nominations to J&K Assembly outside the realm of elected government, says Centre
content: Union Home Ministry says the office of the Lieutenant-Governor was not an extension of the government

title: Farmers, workers to stage protest in Vijayawada on August 13 against U.S. tariffs, ‘anti-farmer’ policies
content: They call for scrapping Free Trade Agreement talks, withdrawal of 50% export tariffs, repeal of market laws and labour codes

title: Injury to R.G. Kar victim’s mother regrettable, says Kolkata Police Commissioner, promises probe
content: The mother of the victim had sustained injuries on forehead during a protest march which, she claimed, were due to assault by police

title: Samiti urges Andhra Pradesh government to ensure smooth Vinayaka Chaviti celebrations
content: It seeks hassle-free clearances, full departmental coordination, and no limits on idol height or extra charges

title: CEO asks Sunilkumar to sign declaration if he takes forward allegations on voters’ list
content: In the letter to Sunilkumar condemning his remarks, the CEO’s office says election officials perform their duties with impartiality, diligence, and in compliance with electoral laws. Constructive feedback and genuine grievances should be channelled through appropriate legal and administrative mechanisms

title: Air warrior who led daring escape from PoW captivity during 1971 Indo-Pak war dies: IAF
content: In its X page, the Indian Air Force also shared an old excerpt from a gallantry award citation on him

title: Haileyburia Tea Estates at Peerumade announces lockout
content: Workers of Semmni Valley, Vallakkadu, Chinnar and  Haileyburia divisions say they have not been provided wages and benefits for two months

title: CPI(M), Congress to highlight ‘voter fraud’ in Thrissur LS polls in campaign against BJP
content: M.A. Baby says ECI helped BJP booth agents add at least 30,000 bogus voters in Thrissur using fudged proof of domicile and forged identities. N.K. Premachandran, MP, says INDIA bloc allies will weigh impeaching the ECI members

title: Good healthcare, education is beyond people’s reach, says RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: Excessive commercialisation of schools and hospitals, which were earlier areas of social service, had taken both education and healthcare out of the common man’s reach in India, Bhagwat said in Indore

title: Four-day Uttar Pradesh legislature session to run till August 14
content: Four-day sitting to see key Bills; Speaker seeks cooperation from all parties as Opposition plans to raise electoral revision, school merger, and law and order issues

title: 354th Aradhana Mahotsava under way at Mantralayam
content: On the third day of the event on Sunday, Peethadhipathi of Sri Raghavendra Temple Sri Subudhendra Tirtha receives Sesha Vastram

title: PM Modi inaugurates long-delayed Yellow Line, taking Bengaluru’s Namma Metro network to 96 km
content: Modi also flags off Vande Bharat Express between Bengaluru and Belagavi, and lays the foundation stone for Namma Metro’s Phase 3

title: Amid threats, the historical habitats of Nilgiri tahr in Coimbatore Forest Division indicate a revival in population
content: The report of the second synchronised survey, which was held in April this year, estimates the State animal’s population at nine in the division. But it also flags forest fires, pilgrimage, and invasive species are major threats to the habitats

title: Suchitwa Keralam rankings for local bodies in the State
content: ‘Suchitwa Keralam’ rankings will grade local government bodies on waste management and cleanliness standards in the State

title: 'Press badge isn’t a shield for terrorism': 5 Al Jazeera journalists killed in Israeli strike - 10 points
content: An Israeli strike near Gaza City's Al-Shifa Hospital resulted in the deaths of at least five Al Jazeera journalists, including correspondent Mohammed Qreiqeh and camera operators. The IDF confirmed targeting Al Jazeera correspondent Anas al-Sharif, alleging he was a Hamas terrorist operative, a claim Al Jazeera denies.

title: Air India flight with K C Venugopal makes emergency diversion; Trivandrum–Delhi flight lands in Chennai
content: An Air India flight AI2455, en route from Thiruvananthapuram to Delhi, was diverted to Chennai due to a suspected technical fault and adverse weather. The flight landed safely, and passengers are being assisted with alternative travel arrangements.

title: US-India tariff tension: Govt to brief Tharoor-led panel today on ties with Washington
content: The parliamentary standing committee on external affairs, led by Shashi Tharoor, will receive a briefing on India's foreign policy developments, particularly regarding US-India trade negotiations and tariffs. The MEA has stated that US secondary sanctions have placed India in an unwanted geopolitical contest, but India remains committed to constructive engagement.

title: Asia Cup: Hardik to undergo fitness assessment; Surya needs another week for full recovery
content: India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav is yet to fully recover from the sports hernia operation he underwent in June in Munich. He is expected to spend another week at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) under the watchful eyes of the physios and medical team. Meanwhile, Shreyas Iyer had cleared his fitness test last month.

title: Mark Zuckerberg hired people at $100 mn-plus pay packages: Skills for job at Meta; Degree in…
content: Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg is aggressively pursuing top AI talent for a new superintelligence lab, targeting researchers from elite universities and leading companies like OpenAI and Google DeepMind. Zuckerberg personally oversees recruitment, offering lucrative packages to secure promising individuals.

title: 'Who will take care of my knee?' — Dhoni keeps IPL future in suspense | Watch
content: Speculation surrounds MS Dhoni's future with Chennai Super Kings ahead of IPL 2026. Following a disappointing IPL 2025 season, the 43-year-old Dhoni, battling knee issues, remains undecided. He humorously addressed fan queries about his participation, citing knee pain concerns. Dhoni's knee has been a recurring issue, requiring surgery after their IPL 2023 victory.

title: Uttarakhand: Flash flood changes Bhagirathi course; river returns to old path
content: Recent ISRO satellite images reveal the Bhagirathi river's dramatic reshaping due to a flash flood in Dharali, triggered by the erosion of a debris fan. The flood altered river channels, submerged buildings, and caused significant topographical shifts.

title: ‘People are going to walk in the door and … ,’ says AI assurance leader at PwC on junior hires
content: PwC is reshaping its training programs as AI transforms the accounting industry. Junior accountants will quickly assume manager-level responsibilities, overseeing AI systems that handle routine tasks. The firm is emphasizing fundamental audit principles, critical thinking, and advanced analytical skills for new hires to adapt to the evolving landscape.

title: 2nd ODI: West Indies level series with five-wicket win over Pakistan in rain-hit clash
content: Roston Chase and Justin Greaves propelled the West Indies to a five-wicket victory over Pakistan in the rain-affected second ODI, leveling the series 1-1. Chasing a revised target of 181, the West Indies reached 184/5 with Chase's unbeaten 49 earning him Player of the Match. Earlier, Pakistan posted 171/7, with Jayden Seales taking 3-23.

title: After NISAR mission, India to launch 6500-kg US communication sat: Isro chief
content: Following the successful launch of the NISAR satellite, ISRO is preparing to launch the US-built Block-2 BlueBird communication satellite. This satellite, weighing 6,500 kg, boasts advanced communication arrays for direct-to-smartphone broadband connectivity, eliminating the need for specialized terminals.

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's 42,000 employees; says: It's a strategy that…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: ‘Son of Sardaar 2’: Ajay Devgn & Mrunal Thakur’s comedy drama mints over Rs 3 crore on Sunday
content: Ajay Devgn's 'Son of Sardaar 2' has earned over Rs 40 crore in India within ten days, outperforming 'Dhadak 2'. Despite steady growth, it faces strong competition from 'Saiyaara' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha'. The film's future hinges on the release of 'War 2', which could significantly impact its box office performance. The movie is a mix of comedy, action, and drama.

title: Bobby Whitlock, Dominos co-founder and music legend, passes away at 77
content: Bobby Whitlock, the keyboardist-singer and co-founder of Dominos, has died at 77 after a brief illness. His wife, Coco Carmel, shared a heartfelt tribute, remembering his adventurous spirit and musical talent.

title: Insiders predict Connor McDavid will re-sign with Edmonton Oilers before NHL training camp
content: Connor McDavid may soon extend his contract with the Edmonton Oilers. Reports suggest a deal could finalize after Team Canada's camp this month. The extension might be for two or four years. The annual value could reach around $17.5 million. This move provides McDavid flexibility. It also gives the Oilers a clear championship focus. Fans await the official announcement.

title: Leylah Fernandez shares surprising dating news ahead of Cincinnati Open
content: Leylah Fernandez, fresh off her Washington victory, revealed she went on her first-ever date after a fan's message caught her eye in Montreal. Following careful vetting with her family's help, she met the fan, even going on a second date. Despite a loss at the Canadian Open, Fernandez feels balanced and ready for the Cincinnati Masters, balancing romance and tennis.

title: Ranthambore's queen, estimated to be 17-18, defies age, seen mating
content: In Ranthambore National Park, the tigress Noor, aged 17 or 18, has been observed mating, defying typical breeding age limits for wild tigers. This rare event, witnessed in Zone 6, highlights Noor's exceptional health and genetics. Despite experts doubting successful pregnancy, her actions challenge nature's norms. Noor's longevity and continued reproductive behavior underscore the wild's unpredictable nature.

title: Allow transplants from deceased with history of diabetes, hypertension: Docs
content: The Indian Society for Organ Transplantation (ISOT) suggests considering organs from deceased donors with diabetes or hypertension for transplantation, emphasizing that benefits often outweigh risks. A detailed assessment co-authored by doctors from 32 top Indian medical institutions, supports individualized risk assessment of donor organs and recipient profiles, rather than outright rejection.

title: 'To ensure no encroachment': Road ministry makes frequent inspection NH mandatory
content: To combat highway encroachments, the road transport ministry mandates frequent inspections by engineers and officers, supplemented by drone videography for regular monitoring. Encroachers will bear the removal costs, along with additional charges and penalties. This directive follows a Supreme Court order addressing NH network encroachments that cause congestion and accidents.

title: 'Sabke boss' mindset behind tariffs on India, says Rajnath
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh asserted that the world recognizes India as a rapidly growing economy with the strength to defend itself, a capability that has drawn envy. He alluded to tariff tensions, predicting that attempts to hinder India's progress through tariffs would fail due to the country's strong position.

title: 'Gaza demilitarised': Netanyahu lays out 5-point agenda for 'quick' takeover plan; thanks Trump
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu asserted that Israel's goal in Gaza is liberation from Hamas, not long-term occupation, outlining five principles for ending the war, including Hamas's disarmament and Israel's security control. He accused Hamas of being a genocidal organization and stated that Gazans desire freedom from their rule.

title: India’s passport climbs several ranks in world's most powerful passports rankings
content: India's passport has improved in the Henley Passport Index, granting access to over 60 nations without prior visas. Asian countries like Singapore, Japan, and South Korea lead the rankings, while the US and UK have declined. Indians can easily visit many African and South-East Asian countries.

title: 6.1-magnitude earthquake hits western Turkey; shaking felt in Istanbul and Izmir
content: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake rattled western Turkey on Sunday evening, impacting cities like Istanbul and Izmir. According to AFAD, the quake struck Balikesir province's Sindirgi district at a depth of 11 km. While the tremor was felt across multiple provinces, initial reports indicate no casualties or significant damage.

title: Tribute to Jota disrupted at Wembley - the reason would shock you
content: A planned tribute for late footballer Diogo Jota faced disruption at Wembley Stadium. This happened during the Community Shield match between Liverpool and Crystal Palace. Some fans failed to maintain silence. This led to boos and an early end to the commemoration. Liverpool fans applauded at the 20-minute mark. Crystal Palace eventually won the title on penalties.

title: Another faceoff? India, Pak navies to hold drills at same time in Arabian Sea
content: The Indian Navy is set to conduct naval drills in the Arabian Sea, coinciding with Pakistan's naval exercises in its territorial waters. These drills follow a tense military standoff in May, during which India's armed forces executed coordinated strikes against Pakistani military assets, including aircraft and radar systems. A notable engagement involved an S-400 missile intercepting a Pakistani surveillance aircraft.

title: BCCI breaks silence on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli’s ODI future
content: The BCCI is in no hurry to decide on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's ODI future amidst speculation about their participation in the 2027 World Cup. With the Australia series in October being the next ODI commitment, their age is a talking point. While a farewell game was rumored, a BCCI source denied such discussions.

title: Healthcare, education out of reach for common man now: RSS chief Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat voiced concerns about the increasing commercialization of healthcare and education, noting their reduced accessibility for the common person. He emphasized the need for affordable and easily accessible medical care, highlighting the limited availability of good cancer treatment in India. Bhagwat also advocated for personalized treatment approaches, recognizing the limitations of uniformly applying Western medical research.

title: Maxwell’s gravity-defying catch seals Aus win over South Africa - Watch
content: Glenn Maxwell's incredible boundary-line catch secured Australia's thrilling 17-run victory over South Africa in the first T20I in Darwin. Tim David's explosive 83 propelled Australia to 178 after a shaky start, while Kwena Maphaka impressed with 4-20 for South Africa. Josh Hazlewood's crucial wickets and Maxwell's late brilliance sealed the win, marking Australia's ninth consecutive T20I triumph.

title: 'Below standard': Kalyan Banerjee attacks Moitra again; regrets remarks on Mamata
content: Kalyan Banerjee, a Trinamool Congress MP, has sharply criticized fellow party leader Mahua Moitra, labeling her as "below standard" and a "wasteful lady," escalating the ongoing tensions within the party. This verbal attack follows a public clash between the two leaders over the South Kolkata Law College rape case.

title: Patrick Mahomes backed by family after being benched by coach Andy Reid in preseason
content: Patrick Mahomes, despite limited playtime in the preseason game against the Cardinals, demonstrated his readiness and leadership. After a brief appearance that included a touchdown pass, Mahomes shifted to a supportive role, advising teammates and offering insights to the coaching staff. Coach Reid praised Mahomes' leadership, emphasizing his importance to the team's Super Bowl aspirations.

title: 'Vote chori' claims: K'taka top poll officer sends notice to Rahul, seeks proof
content: The Election Commission has demanded evidence from Rahul Gandhi regarding his claims of voter fraud in Karnataka during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Gandhi alleged that over a lakh votes were stolen in Mahadevapura through duplicate entries and fake addresses. He urged the EC to release digital voter rolls for public audit.

title: Elon Musk updates Mars mission timeline: Starship crewed by Optimus possible in 2026; real target now 2028–2030
content: Elon Musk has adjusted SpaceX's Mars mission timeline, pushing back the potential Starship launch to 2028 for uncrewed flights and 2030 for crewed missions. Technical hurdles, including Starship failures and in-space refuelling delays, prompted the shift from the initial 2026 target.

title: Wayne Gretzky’s silence on Trump’s anti-Canada rhetoric still sparks debate yrs later
content: Wayne Gretzky, once a Canadian icon, faced public backlash in the mid-2020s due to his perceived silence during a politically sensitive period between Canada and the United States. His friendship with Donald Trump and attendance at Trump's events, combined with his refusal to publicly defend Canada against Trump's remarks, sparked outrage.

title: 'There's some boss who ...': Rajnath mocks Trump's attempt to damage India's economy
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticized the US President's tariff hikes on Indian imports, suggesting that some global powers are attempting to hinder India's economic progress due to jealousy over its rapid growth. Despite these challenges, Singh asserted India's unstoppable rise as a major global power, highlighting the country's increasing defence exports as a sign of resilience and strength.

title: 'Largest surface-to-air kill': IAF chief on how S-400 was game-changer in India-Pak face-off
content: Air Chief Marshal A P Singh revealed that during Operation Sindoor, India achieved its largest surface-to-air kill by downing a Pakistani aircraft at 300km, crediting the S-400 system. The IAF also confirmed five kills of Pakistani fighters through electronic means. India targeted Pakistani airbases and infrastructure, including hangars and radar sites, causing significant damage and operational disruptions.

title: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister In Double Voter ID Row, Poll Body Sends Notice
content: A notice has been issued to Bihar's Deputy Chief Minister and senior BJP leader Vijay Kumar Sinha for allegedly possessing two voter ID cards and being registered as a voter in two places.

title: US Tourist In Puerto Rico For Bad Bunny Concert Fatally Shot
content: A US tourist who was visiting Puerto Rico for Bad Bunny's residency was fatally shot at La Perla, a popular seaside shantytown, police said.

title: Lights, Camera, Policy: Delhi To Get New Filming Plan To Attract Global Eye
content: Delhi is eyeing a place on the global film map, with Chief Minister Rekha Gupta announcing plans to roll out a new policy to position the national capital as an international shooting destination.

title: Assam Thadou Tribe Chief Defends Manipur Peace Meet, Calls For Unity
content: A Thadou tribe chief of a village in Assam's Dima Hasao has strongly condemned threats and online abuse against him for attending an event themed on peace in Manipur's capital Imphal.

title: 6.1 Earthquake Hits Turkey, Some Buildings Cave In, Rescue Ops Begin
content: A 6.1-magnitude quake struck Sindirgi in western Turkey on Sunday, the Turkish disaster management agency (AFAD) said on Sunday.

title: Man Clings To Austrian High-Speed Train, Survives
content: A man has survived clinging to the outside of an Austrian high-speed train, Austria's state railway said, reportedly after it left whilst he was having a cigarette break.

title: ISRO To Launch 6,500 Kg Communication Satellite Built By US
content: After marking a humble beginning in the Indian space programme with a tiny rocket supplied by the United States, ISRO would launch a 6,500 kg communication satellite built by the US in the next couple of months, V Narayanan said.

title: Ex-Boyfriend Arrested Days After Odisha Woman Set Herself On Fire
content: The police, on Sunday, arrested the accused ex-boyfriend in connection with the self-immolation death of a 20-year-old girl at her residence in Pattamundai area of Odisha's Kendrapara district earlier this week.

title: Delivery Rider Falls Into Open Drain, Loses Phone; Union Asks Zomato To Help
content: A food delivery worker in Hyderabad fell into a drain while on duty amid heavy rains prompting calls from the Telangana gig workers' union for accountability from the company.

title: 3 Missing Shimla Boarding School Students Found, Kidnapper Arrested: Cops
content: Three class 6 students of a boys' boarding school in Shimla were recovered from a house in Chaithla village of Kotkhai area here on Sunday, a day after they went missing during a day out.

title: Norway-Style E-Waste Processing Revolution Planned For Delhi
content: Delhi is gearing up to build one of India's most advanced e-waste processing facilities, and it's taking cues from Norway's cutting-edge model.

title: Anand Sharma Resigns As Chairman Of Congress' Foreign Affairs Department
content: Veteran Congress leader Anand Sharma resigned as the chairman of the party's foreign affairs department on Sunday to help in its reconstitution and enable bringing in younger leaders.

title: "Perpetual Youth": BJP Rips Into Rahul Gandhi Over Voter List Allegations
content: The BJP has rubbished the "fake voter" allegations of the Congress, and accused Rahul Gandhi of "demeaning" constitutional bodies under the "pressure of foreign and anti-India forces".

title: Assam Opposition Targets Himanta Sarma Over Voter Revision, Eviction Drives
content: Leaders of the All Indian United Democratic Front, a key opposition party in Assam, accused Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of failing to maintain law and order in the state.

title: CBI Busts Illegal Call Centre Racket In Maharashtra, 5 Arrested
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has busted an illegal call centre racket, being run by certain private persons in rented premises, in Igatpuri (Rainforest Resort), Nashik, Maharashtra, an official statement said.

title: Video: Syria Hospital Staff Forced To Kneel. One Who Rose Up Shot Dead
content: An undated video released by the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights (SOHR) shows the execution of employees of a hospital by fighters loyal to Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa's government, reports Russian state-controlled media RT.

title: Video: Elephant Attacks Car Near Toll Plaza On Dehradun-Haridwar Highway
content: A huge wild elephant caused chaos near a toll plaza on the Dehradun-Haridwar highway today after attacking vehicles waiting to pass through the crowded road.

title: Congress Turns 'Vote Chori' Allegation Into Campaign Ahead Of Bihar Polls
content: The Congress launched its "Vote Chori" (vote theft) campaign today, demanding transparency from the Election Commission in maintaining voter rolls.

title: SISA Launches AI-Driven StackSQ At NASSCOM Conclave
content: SISA has launched AI-driven StackSQ at the two-day NASSCOM Future Forge conclave in Bengaluru. The launch was led by NASSCOM's AI lead Ankit Bose. StackSQ has been developed as SISA's response to this growing challenge of software risk.

title: UK F-35B Fighter Jet Makes Emergency Landing In Japan, Delays Some Flights
content: A UK Royal Air Force F-35B fighter jet made an emergency landing at Japan's Kagoshima airport after experiencing a mechanical problem mid-air, local media reported.

title: Defensive frailties dog Liverpool, but new signings show quality
